summary: An Ordinance of the City of Seattle, amending Section 12 of Ordinance No. 18031, entitled "An Ordinance of the City of Seattle granting to the Seattle and Montana Railroad Company, its successors and assigns, the right, privilege and authority to lay down, construct, maintain and operate sundry railway tracks along and across sundry streets, avenues, alleys and other public places within the City of Seattle, and upon other property within the limits of the said City, and granting to said company, its successors and assigns, rights of way for such tracks along and across such streets, avenues, alleys and other public places of said City."
